inclusion.criterion: NYHA functional class II to IV without cirrhosis and/or ascites
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Signs of heart failure in the previous 12-months with or without having been hospitalized
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Stable optimized medical and/or interventional treatment
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Ineligible for corrective action on the valve by surgical approach after a specialized multidisciplinary consultation
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: Central core-laboratory analysis : TR characterized before Implantation by at least one of the following criteria
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: Surface of the regurgitant orifice > 40 mm²
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Any prior tricuspid valve procedure that would interfere with placement of the Triclip device
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Tricuspid valve leaflet anatomy which may preclude clip implantation, proper clip positioning on the leaflets or sufficient reduction in TR
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Evidence of calcification in the grasping area
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Evidence of stenosis (mean pressure gradient > 5 mmHg or surface area ≤1cm²
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Presence of a severe coaptation defect (> 2cm) of the tricuspid leaflets
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Severe leaflet defect(s) preventing proper device placement
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Epstein anomaly - identified by having a normal annulus position while the valve leaflets are attached to the walls and septum of the right ventricle
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: 34 year old woman with Marfan's syndrome and known severe mitral valve prolapse with regurgitation, who was planned for a MV repair but was lost to follow-up. She remains symptomatic and is now prepared to undergo mitral valve repair/replacement surgery.
